CatDescriptText: Mrs. Helen R. Phillips, 128 Lincoln Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, pg. 1A with question: "Do you think that the average family spends too much time watching television programs? If so, how has it affected family life?" answer reads: "I don't think that the average family does spend too much time watching television.  If they have anything better to do, they don't watch it.  I don't know about the kids of high school age.  When we got our television set, our kids were too busy to spend too much time watching it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Helen R. Phillips wearing earrings, light colored coat, and dark gloves, holding handbag, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
